The management team has tremendous growth opportunities, and they want to continue receiving investment grade ratings from the remaining rating agencies. My experiences with MLPs shows that raising the dividend at the expense of a strong balance sheet will come back to bite investors. They need to work towards cash flow covering capex and distribution (dividend). At the present time, a meaningful world footprint is needed for scale. I think dilutions will continue for the near future.

DLR has moved nicely since they were on Cramer. For all the criticism of Cramer, he has had a pretty good track record of late, so if you were in Square or Kratos, or NVDIA, you are doing pretty damn good. So I listened to CONE on his show and I was impressed with the growth potential of this REIT in a space where a lot of REITs are hurting, especially those involved in malls. Im thinking many more people will work from home even in some big companies. That will increase the need for more cloud computing just in that sphere. There will be more need for space for these storage facilities and they are very specialized, not like a Storage unit. So the growth potential here seems to move with the expansion of tech. And if tech is moving, so shall CONE. DLR has proven that and so has CONE with its nice moves in the last year. How muchmore, I ask this board to give opinions. Let's hear it.
